oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FULLERENES FROM CAMPHOR - A NATURAL SOURCE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MUKHOPADHYAY, K
KRISHNA, KM
SHARON, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electron-microscopy
c-60
c60
spectroscopy
films
superconductivity
separation
c-70
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fullerenes are prepared from a natural source, camphor, for the first time. The films are deposited on a Si substrate, by a vacuum evaporation technique from the toluene extract of ether insoluble camphor soot. A fast atomic bombardment mass spectrum shows the presence of C60 along with other members of the fullerene family. Crystalline fullerene thin films grown on a Si wafer have been investigated by x-ray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy (SEM). X-ray diffraction measurements have identified that the crystals of C60 have the hexagonal close packed structure. SEM pictures reveal the surface distribution of spherical C60 clusters.
